dmca.title: FFShrine Violation
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Legal Response [mailto:legal-response2@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Monday, March 06, 2006 11:39 AM
To: 'ghaleonstar1@hotmail.com'
Subject: FW: FFShrine Violation

 To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: Harry Simons [mailto:ghaleonstar1@hotmail.com]
Sent: Sunday, March 05, 2006 3:08 AM
To: legal-response@theplanet.com
Subject: FFShrine Violation

Hello Server Matrix,

A certain website by the name of Final Fantasy Shrine (www.ffshrine.org) is
hosting illegal MP3s on its sub-site, Galbadia Hotel
(http://gh.ffshrine.org). I believe this goes against your Copyright policy,
and I do have emails from various composers stating that they gave no
permission to this website for hosting their music. They have admitted
themselves that they are pirating these Original Soundtracks. Can you please
do something about this, as these composers and companies do not like having
pirated goods up for grabs?

Thanks,

Harry

_________________________________________________________________
New year, new job - there's more than 100,00 jobs at SEEK
http://a.ninemsn.com.au/b.aspx?URL=http%3A%2F%2Fninemsn%2Eseek%2Ecom%2Eau&_t
=752315885&_r=Jan05_tagline&_m=EXT
